    • Method Detail

      • runOpMode

        public void runOpMode()
        Specified by:
        runOpMode in class com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode

      • gyroDrive

        public void gyroDrive(double speed,
                      double distance,
                      double angle)
        Method to drive on a fixed compass bearing (angle), based on encoder counts. Move will stop if either of these conditions occur: 1) Move gets to the desired position 2) Driver stops the opmode running.
        Parameters:
        speed - Target speed for forward motion. Should allow for _/- variance for adjusting heading
        distance - Distance (in inches) to move from current position. Negative distance means move backwards.
        angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.

      • gyroTurn

        public void gyroTurn(double speed,
                     double angle)
        Method to spin on central axis to point in a new direction. Move will stop if either of these conditions occur: 1) Move gets to the heading (angle) 2) Driver stops the opmode running.
        Parameters:
        speed - Desired speed of turn.
        angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.

      • gyroHold

        public void gyroHold(double speed,
                     double angle,
                     double holdTime)
        Method to obtain & hold a heading for a finite amount of time Move will stop once the requested time has elapsed
        Parameters:
        speed - Desired speed of turn.
        angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.
        holdTime - Length of time (in seconds) to hold the specified heading.

      • getError

        public double getError(double targetAngle)

      • getSteer

        public double getSteer(double error,
                       double PCoeff)
        returns desired steering force. +/- 1 range. +ve = steer left
        Parameters:
        error - Error angle in robot relative degrees
        PCoeff - Proportional Gain Coefficient
        Returns:
